p: Flavonoids exhibit a diphenyl propaneâ€“flavone skeleton with a three-carbon bridge between phenyl groups and commonly cyclized with oxygen. Epicatechin O-glucoside ( 28), hyperoside ( 19), isorhamnetin ( 18), isorhamnetin-3-O-glucoside ( 23), isorhamnetin 3,7-diglucoside ( 25), isorhamnetin 3-O-galactoside ( 27), isorhamnetin 3-O-robinobioside ( 26), isorhamnetin 3-rutinoside ( 24), kaempferol ( 15), myricetin ( 16), quercetin ( 17), quercetin 3-glucoside ( 21), quercetin 3-rutinoside ( 22) and quercitrin ( 20) are isolated from different tissues of B. aegyptiaca ( Table 5; Figure 3) [ 19, 20, 21, 22].
